title: Sexual orientation : views on nature vs. nurture in the U.S. 1977 to 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 3 lines namely Born with, Upbringing/environment, and Both. The y axis represents Share of respondent and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Born with is gradually increasing, Upbringing/environment, and Both are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share of respondent in descending order is: 1. Upbringing/environment, 2. Born with, and lastly, 3. Both.
Overall across the Year, Upbringing/environment mostly maintained the highest Share of respondent when compared to others with a mean value of 39.68, and it peaked at 1977.
After Upbringing/environment, Born with overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 37.2, peaking at 2015.
Both mostly had the least Share of respondent with a mean value of 10.82, which peaked at 1977 with a value of 14.0.
